page.title: 20CAMPING WITH THE SCHOOL.
page.content: About 20 children from the Junior School go to camp for the weekend. The site is at a farm about 2 miles out of Skelton. There are a number of tents that sleep three or four children each. Cooking is on a wood fire which keeps the children busy foraging for wood. Other chores include fetching water, digging waste holes, and helping with the preparation of food. The children may play in the extensive woods adjacent to the field. There is a rope swing from a very high tree which swings out 40 feet to a height of 20 feet above the ground. The toilets arrangements are chemical. The children sit around the fire ater dark. Nobody is allowed to bring sweets or money. Sweets are given out from time to time. The children like to watch milking in the evening.
